instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
Hey guy's 

working on 820 2936 with water damage around SMC, <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> ! 

Trace already fixed: Pin1 <RESISTOR>R5301</RESISTOR> to pin4 <TRANSISTOR>Q4260</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>  and pin2 <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> to pin2 <RESISTOR>R2578</RESISTOR>. 

i already replace <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and Replace SMC from donor board!! No changes, 12.32V on PPBus, SMC not running.. what more could be the problem of 12.30v?

regard's

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
Did you even check basic signals and power for SMC?
Next, check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.

Is 3V42 present?

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
3V42 - 3.42V 
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.200V 

when you say basic signals for you Which are they?

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (3 of 3), page 45.

3V at pins 12/13 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> present?

Also check RTC signals and 32KHz from <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
3.4v on pins 12/13 . 

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 0.606V 

and also check RTC signals- 3.4V and 32kHz OK!

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 0.606V"
It is bad...

Post other voltages of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Resolder all the pads around chip.

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message: Ok 2informaticos!! thank you for your's reply's! i will resolder and double check on dead spots if missing any trace!! i will pos the results!!

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
coming back to this, and what solve the problem was replace 51125! On this moment the machines turn's on but show this errors on ASD testes! 

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-ndgFdoxmL5qRc0CpkqaplzaDmeHUnup/view?usp=sharing[/url] 

can you advice me what can be?? thanks

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
VP0R should be <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> I think.
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR> area.

IO0R is probably related with <CHIP>U5360</CHIP>, or maybe <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>/10.

Th1H is related with Q/<CHIP>U5520</CHIP>.

Do you get more errors?

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
VP0R - Fixed - (replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>)

IO'R - Fixed - (Replacing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>)

TH1H - non Fixed !! already replace <CHIP>U5520</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R5520</RESISTOR> = ok and traces, <RESISTOR>R5521</RESISTOR>/22 = ok and traces! (This area don't have any corrusion). already replace <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR> and check traces to <CHIP>U5520</CHIP> it's ok and for descharge i solder 2 wires on respective traces! but fan it's always on high! 

I have one more error! - ERROR - MOTOR IS SPINING SLOWER THAN IT SHOULD  - test failed - 


thans

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:
Bad trackpad board/flex also cause high fan spin.
Do you get any related error on ASD?

Even ALS issue can cause that.
Check J3402 and its traces.
Also try known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: 820 2936, Water damage, no green Light 12.30V on PPBUS
threads.message:

the only errors i have is TH1H AND this: 

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YMHr6rt1loALq7D03BVuirdSYruJMdNm/view?usp=sharing[/url]

ALS ? what you mean? 

J3402 checked and it seems to me that it's okay. 

in this moment i only have a 3115 board working to compare values!
